node.title: Matthew McConaughey Says He Will Not Run for Texas Governor ‘at This Moment’
node.alt: Matthew McConaughey during the South by Southwest festival in Austin, Texas, in 2019.
node.description: With about two weeks before the candidate filing deadline for the Texas primary, the actor said a run for office is “a path that I’m choosing not to take at this moment.”
node.content: ["The actor and author Matthew McConaughey announced on Sunday that he would not run for governor of Texas for now, after months of weighing whether he would seek the office.", "In a video posted on Twitter and Instagram, Mr. McConaughey, 52, said running for governor is a \u201chumbling and inspiring path to ponder.\u201d", "\u201cIt is also a path that I\u2019m choosing not to take at this moment,\u201d he said.", "Mr. McConaughey\u2019s announcement came about two weeks before the candidate filing deadline for the Texas primary, and about two weeks after Beto O\u2019Rourke, a former El Paso congressman and 2020 Democratic presidential candidate, announced his run for the office against Gov. Greg Abbott, a Republican.", "Mr. McConaughey\u2019s announcement also came weeks after he drew widespread attention for saying that he would not mandate vaccines for young children because he would like more information, adding that in his household, \u201cwe go slow on vaccinations, even before Covid.\u201d", "Instead of running for governor, Mr. McConaughey said, he would continue to support entrepreneurs, businesses and foundations that are \u201cleaders,\u201d establishments that are \u201ccreating pathways for people to succeed in life,\u201d and \u201corganizations that have a mission to serve and build trust, while also generating prosperity.\u201d", "\u201cThat\u2019s the American dream,\u201d he said. \u201cAnd politicians? The good ones can help us get to where we need to go. Yeah, but let\u2019s be clear: They can\u2019t do anything for us unless we choose to do for ourselves.\u201d", "When asked about whether he would run for governor in an interview in October on the New York Times podcast \u201cSway,\u201d Mr. McConaughey said he was learning more about politics and measuring whether politics is \u201can embassy for me to be of the most use to myself, to my family, to the most amount of people in my life moving forward.\u201d", "\u201cI like to measure things before I partake,\u201d he said on the podcast. \u201cAnd you\u2019ve got to partake before you\u2019ve partook.\u201d", "Mr. McConaughey is known for roles in movies that include \u201cInterstellar,\u201d \u201cThe Wolf of Wall Street\u201d and \u201cDallas Buyers Club,\u201d for which he won the Academy Award for best actor in 2014. Last year, he published a memoir, \u201cGreenlights.\u201d", "Mr. McConaughey had not previously indicated whether he would run for governor as a Republican or a Democrat.", "Mr. Abbott, who has been governor since 2014, is seeking a third term in a state where no Democrat has won a statewide election since 1994.", "In a poll released last week by The Dallas Morning News and the University of Texas at Tyler, voters said they would be more likely to support Mr. McConaughey than Mr. O\u2019Rourke by almost 2-to-1.", "In a hypothetical three-way general election contest, Mr. Abbott was the favorite with 37 percent of the vote, followed by Mr. McConaughey with 27 percent and Mr. O\u2019Rourke with 26 percent. Ten percent of voters in the poll wanted someone else."]
